text: Isolation and culture of primary CD8+ T cells .

<extra_id_0> CD8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells from 4-8-wk-old <extra_id_0> Tcra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - x P14 TCR transgenic ( Taconic ) , C57BL / 6J WT , or <extra_id_0> Tbx21 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - ( The Jackson Laboratory ) mice were purified ( > 95 % purity ) by negative selection ( Invitrogen ) from pooled spleen and lymph node cells .

<extra_id_0> CD8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells from <extra_id_0> Runx3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice on the ICR background were purified by positive selection ( Miltenyi Biotec ) .

All mice were maintained in specific pathogen-free barrier facilities and used according to protocols approved by the Immune Disease Institute and the Harvard Medical School Animal Care and Use Committees .

For stimulation , purified <extra_id_0> CD8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells were cultured at 106 cells / ml ( 10 ml ) in T25 flasks coated with 1 mug / ml each of anti - <extra_id_0> CD3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( clone 2C11 ) and anti - <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( clone 37.51 ) by pretreatment with 300 mug / ml goat anti-hamster IgG .
After 48 h , cells were removed from the TCR stimulation and recultured at a concentration of 5 x 105 cells / ml in media supplemented with 100 U / ml rhIL-2 .
Every 24 h , viable cells were counted and readjusted to 5 x 105 cells / ml with fresh media containing the corresponding amount of <extra_id_0> rhIL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
